Is the organisation registered with MyHMCTS?
What type of personal injury is this?

### You don't have a registered PBA. ### This case will not be saved. ## Register an existing PBA with MyHMCTS If you want to pay with a different PBA, you or your organisation administrator will need to email MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk to ask for your PBA to be registered with your MyHMCTS account. You should include your organisation name and PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for your account to be updated. You’ll need to start your claim again to pay the fee. ## Apply to get a new PBA You can use this form to apply for a new PBA account. You’ll need to provide details for you and your organisation, including the required credit limit for your account. Once your account has been registered, you’ll need to start your claim again to pay the fee. Read more information on registering a PBA.
Hide pba and show noPbaAccountLabel
Comment: workaround field to show noPbaAccountsLabel when applicantSolicitor1PbaAccounts is empty. Also hides applicantSolicitor1PbaAccounts

Label:
Pay with another PBA
## If there’s 1 PBA listed If you want to pay with a different PBA, you or your organisation administrator will need to email MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk to ask for your PBA to be registered with your MyHMCTS account. You should include your organisation name and PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for your account to be updated. You’ll need to start your claim again to pay the fee. ## If there are 2 PBAs listed You won’t be able to add another PBA. You can only submit this case online using one of the PBAs from the menu. If you want to remove a PBA, you or your organisation administrator will need to email MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk. You should include the PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for the PBA to be removed. We’ll send you confirmation. Select ‘cancel’ below to discard the case.

The claimant(s) believes that the facts stated in the brief details of claim are true. 

I am duly authorised by the claimant(s) to sign this statement.

The claimant(s) understands that proceedings for contempt of court may be brought against anyone who makes, or causes to be made, a false statement in a document verified by a statement of truth without an honest belief in its truth.

_Definition: The statement of truth acknowledged by the first applicant solicitor of the issue of the claim.

Label: Date claim issued
_Definition: The derived legal date the claim is deemed issued. It is based on the date time when the claim was submitted digitally

Label: Defendant 2 solicitor deadline
_Definition: The date time by which the second respondent solicitor has to submit the response to the claim.

Label: Enter defendant legal representative's email address to be used for notifications
Enter organisation details manually. The claim will then continue offline.
If you continue the defendant legal representative's organisation will be notified and will be granted access to this claim.

## Provide brief details of the claim
Briefly describe the claim but do not include the full Particulars of Claim. You can provide the Particulars of Claim on the next page.

Use this space to provide additional details such as the date of the accident if making a Personal Injury claim, the date of the alleged negligence if making a clinical negligence claim, the contract start date if making a claim for breach of contract and any other supporting details.

Alternatively, you will have the opportunity, on the next screen, to change any of the answers before clicking the "submit" button.
